title: From gargantuan shoulders to tropical blooms: ugly versus beautiful at Balenciaga and Valentino
text:
Surgically altered faces have become normal in fashion - and anywhere celebrities and the super-rich congregate. Was it wise then – or good manners - for Demna Gvasalia to add prosthetics to the models’ faces in his show for Balenciaga on Sunday?

Perhaps you need enhanced cheek-bones and swollen mouths to balance out shoulders padded to nearly a metre wide, or down jackets so inflated that the neck was lost entirely, heads popping out turtle-like. But some of those parodic faces looked like a less than temperate attempt to belittle the very women who buy this label.

This was not an obviously appealing collection even by usual Balenciaga standards. Previously, creative director Demna Gvasalia’s...
description: Surgically altered faces have become normal in fashion - and anywhere celebrities and the super-rich congregate.
